desc: We are looking to create a video that helps students see what is going on in their brain when they study for school. In particular, we want to focus on the idea of "synaptic plasticity": when you make new memories and learn new concepts, new physical connections are made between cells in your brain.The video would be a voice-over of someone explaining the concept, and animations of brain cells forming a connection and sending electrical signals to each other. Here's a video of someone explaining the concept: [url removed, login to view]
title: Neuroscience Animated Education Video

desc: I want a video to show an animated character (3D), hold a chain in his hand (we'll call him TED, for now), connected a business person (suit & tie, holding a briefcase).  The chain is currently pulled tight between the TED and the biz person.  TED starts pushing the chain, but the chain just coils to the ground, showing how ineffective pushing against a chain is.  TED then picks up the chain, walks a little to the background, and tries again, then walks a little to the foreground, and tries again, all with failure, with the moral of the story being: you cannot push against a chain.
title: Video push against a chain

desc: Need a 3D Artist to do some minor remodeling changes to a 3D dragon (see attached), Rig, Weight Paint, Pose Morph Facial Expressions, and Adjust Textures/UV Mapping for the Dragon so it’s ready to be Animated, Rendered, and Composited into a scene. The Render Settings are: Physical Renderer, Global Illumination (Light Mapping for Secondary Method), Ambient Occlusion, No Default Lights under Options, Cubic (Still Image), and TIFF Sequence at 1920x1080 Resolution. The Remodeling will cover minor details, but the UV map and Textures need to be adjusted to compensate for the changed geometry. Preferably the 3D modeling should be done in Cinema 4d, but the Rigging, Weight Painting, Texture Adjustments/UV Mapping, and Final Delivery would preferably be done in Cinema 4D R19. The Dragon itself needs to look very realistic, so the Skin Textures need to appear as bumpy, rough, reflective, and organically colorful as a Reptile and Dinosaur's Skin and not plastic (more detail the better). The areas that need to be remodeled are the Face so it appears unique and unrecognizable to other well known dragons (more impressive, prideful and intimidating than terrifying with large teeth), The Top Section of the Dragon In front of the Wings need to be clear of any horns and unnecessary geometry. The Dragon Type and Detail Level is provided in the Uploaded Images, however, the skin needs to look less plastic and more like organic leather. The Rig especially needs to be created in C4D to setup a IK character rig and be weight painted correctly. Create a Rig with IK Controllers for the Legs, Wings, Tail (IK Spline) and Head for the long neck. Head and neck needs to easily stretch out Vertically, Horizontally, and in an "S" pose, so if an IK spline isn't plausible then use FK. The Wings are like a bats (illustrated in Uploaded Bat Image). The sheets of skin between the Wings' Arms and Fingers need to fold and wrinkle in a realistic way, so the wings are able to fold away from the body in a realistic looking way. The Eyes should have separate controllers than a single one, and Pose Morph the Head to include several different facial expressions, including shooting fire from its mouth. The goal is for us to be able to start animating and composition in C4D R19 in-house after delivery without any pre-animation work such as expressions and rigging.
title: I need to texture and rigg the dragon in cinema 4d R19
